metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15672 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
The read_header function in libavcodec/ffv1dec.c in FFmpeg 2.4 and 3.3.4 and possibly earlier allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted MP4 file, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec58 - 7:3.4-1
libavdevice58 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter7 - 7:3.4-1
libavformat-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:3.4-1
libavformat58 - 7:3.4-1
libavutil56 - 7:3.4-1
libpostproc55 - 7:3.4-1
libswresample3 - 7:3.4-1
libswscale5 - 7:3.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4-1').
